fields.value: Drinking and Driving:  A Survey of Licensed Drivers in the United States, 1983

dsDescriptionValue.value: This study focuses on the drinking and driving habits of  Americans. The questionnaire contained 51 questions. Respondents were  interviewed over the telephone and asked about their frequency of  consumption of alcoholic beverages, where they most often drank,   their mode of transportation to and from this location, their driving  and drinking experiences, and their age, sex, educational attainment, and socioeconomic status.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XVII.E. Social Institutions and Behavior, Crime and the Criminal Justice System
NACJD XI. Drugs, Alcohol, and Crime

Existing hardcopy documentation was converted to PDF.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: LRECL with SAS, SPSS, and Stata setup files, SAS transport file, and SPSS portable file;Subject: Study Level Error Note, Notes: The codebook is provided as a Portable Document Format  (PDF) file. The PDF file format was developed by Adobe Systems  Incorporated and can be accessed using PDF reader software, such as  the Adobe Acrobat Reader. Information on how to obtain a copy of the Acrobat Reader is provided on the ICPSR Web site.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: Stata system file(s), SPSS portable file(s), Data file(s), SAS transport - XPORT engine file(s), and electronic documentation.;

distributorName.value: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research

distributorAffiliation.value: Institute for Social Research, University of Michigan

value: The universe for this study is adults 16 years of age and older who possessed a valid driver's license.

fields.value: The first 1,000 cases were drawn using a national  probability sample of the 48 contiguous states. The final 400 cases  were selected from an oversample of 20 states. Conditions were imposed  to yield approximately 50 percent males and 50 percent females.  Respondents were interviewed over the telephone using random-digit dialing.
Checked for undocumented or out-of-range codes.
